Background.text:
Autosomal recessive
Impairment of biliary cellular copper excretion with accumulation in organs (mostly liver, brain, cornea)
Liver becomes cirrhotic with ~5% developing liver failure

Clinical_Features.text:
Hepatic
Kayser-Fleischer rings (highly specific)
Asymptomatic (steatosis, chronic hepatitis, compensated
cirrhosis
)

(
acute liver failure
/
hepatitis

,
hepatomegaly
, splenomegaly,
ascites
Upper GI bleeding
; sequela of cirrhosis with varices
Neurologic symptoms
Dysarthria
Gait abnormalities
Dystonia
Tremor
Parkinsonism
Psychiatric symptoms
Depression
, personality changes, impulsiveness,
psychosis

Workup.text:
LFTs
to assess ALT/AST
CBC to assess for anemia (followed by testing for Coombs-negative hemolytic anemia)
Ocular slit-lamp to assess for Kayser-Flesicher rings

Diagnosis.text: Outpatient ceruloplasmin concentration, serums copper concentration, 24-hour urinary copper excretion +/- genetic testing can be done to confirm diagnosis

Management.text:
Potent chelators: D-penicillamine (first-line), trientine (second-line), oral zinc
Low-copper diet

Disposition.text:
Hepatology consult should be made for follow up
Screening for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) recommended but unclear association
